Fields.DialogueText: ... Aren't hobbits curious creatures, Captain?
Huh? What are you talking about, Ark?
These mythical creatures that J.R.R. Tolkien created appeal to the English. My question is, why?
Why do people like the book, or why did he create them?
Captain, if I wanted a sweet tease, I would have made a pun by now. Yes, I am wondering why people like this book.

Fields.MenuText: He is an Oxford professor.
The book is actually good.
It's a book for children, Ark.

Fields.DialogueText: True, that he is. But not all professors publish "good" books.
It... is, but it is not the type of material I read on a daily basis.
If it was nothing more than a book for children, would I have read it in the first place?
I am wondering, if Tolkien can release a book, what is to say I cannot? But...
But what?
In the end we will never have enough resources or money to publish my thousand recipes. We are at war, not on vacation.
Ark...
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Ark, do you have a moment?
Huff... why would you disturb my endurance exercises?
Ah, sorry! I didn't realize you were busy.
It... is all right. What may I do to help you, Captain?
Have you ever wondered where you would want to travel if we weren't at war? Say--
Japan, without a doubt.
Why there?
On paper, they may be our enemies, Zurich Agreement or no. But that does not mean I turn a blind eye to living human beings.
Hm, true.
I've met many elegant people that know so much about "Wabi-Sabi" and the Japanese culture. Do you remember when our ship made contact with that Japanese ship?
What's that?
One of their crewmen taught me the art of crane folding. Supposedly, if you fold a thousand of them, they are a blessing at weddings and can grant wishes.

Fields.MenuText: That's a lot of cranes.
Where do you even store that many cranes?
Sounds like an old wives' tale to me...

Fields.DialogueText: The challenge is huge, but with diligence and endurance, it's a piece of cake.
The crewman said that, traditionally, one hangs them all on a single string.
Would anyone believe you if you told them your ship had manifested a spirit? Do not doubt so easily, Captain.
...Hm. I may have brewed a kettle of ideas...
Eh?
@BATTLE
Yes, why?
*ALARM*
We knead to dough-feat these Morganas!
@BATTLE
How in bloody hel-- ahem... How do I even do this?! I am supposed to squash this side and it is supposed to turn into a square... What am I doing wrong?
Ugh, where's the blea-- Ark? What are you doing in the janitor's closet?
Oh, hello, Captain. Please, come in. Not there, there's a leak. On that bucket is good. I am trying to fold a paper crane.
Wait, where did you get the paper?
The chef gave me a page from his recipe book to practice with, Captain. However, the art of folding a crane according to Japanese instructions is fairly difficult...
Argh... sorry. Just frustrated, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: Can I help?
I might be able to translate the message if you show it to me?
You're paying attention to something that isn't a recipe? That's not like you...

Fields.DialogueText: With all due respect, I'd prefer you didn't. I will never learn unless I try.
... I'd prefer you didn't. I can figure this out myself, Captain.
... It is related to recipe making, Captain.
Folding this crane may prove the answer to all my problems!
Uh, I'm not sure how that will help.
You are being a spotted di–
...ctator?
...That was not what I had in mind, but that will have to do.
Hmmm, hmm, all right...there's the knight wrapped up, the queen, the bishops... Now, lastly, the board... Ah, there it is. Package ready for departure!
Whoa, that package is huge! Who are you sending it to?
An Englishman, Captain!
What? An ordinary man back home?
Yes, if you are stating the plain vanilla truth. It is a secret... peace offering. He wants to correspond with a Lady once in his life.
He might just throw it away. Who knows what's in their mail these days?
I have not thought about it, but I doubt he'll be the type of man to run from a challenge.
I sensed there was more.
I am challenging him to a game of chess, but we are not facing each other in real time.
We each have a board and a record of our opponent's pieces. Over time, we shall send each other each move we make, and adjust the board as needed.
Oh, I see. It's correspondence chess.
Exactly, Captain. This man cannot turn down a challenge. And I will use this weakness to befriend him!

Fields.MenuText: I have a bad feeling about this...
What if he actually becomes your friend?
You could just give him one of your recipes...

Fields.DialogueText: Maybe so, but I have to try whatever the circumstances are presented, just like I wanted to get my recipes to be known to the rest of the world.
I don't understand, Captain. Surely that's the point?
I thought of that, Captain. Unfortunately, he hasn't got a sweet tooth.
At any rate, I set up the chess table in this corner of the control room. Please make sure the rest of the crew do not touch it.
I'll let them know, Ark. But I don't think you should put this in the control room.
It's the safest place for it, Captain. But we'll have to discuss this later - we've got company.
@BATTLE
Hm... That smell...
Ark, we need you down in the boiler room. One of the--
Just a second, Captain.
But--
Look, Captain. Do you see those pale green things by the port? They grow out of the ground like trees, but they are so small...
I believe that's grass, Ark.
Is that what you call it? It looks so soft....
Do you want me to go get a handful for you?
No. Sometimes it is best to remember why you are imprisoned, rather than to taste freedom.
Ark...
Please do not look at me that way, Captain. I am simply being realistic.
My world is so small. The ship, the crew. If I was offered something that people have on land... I don't know if I could bear it.
As foolish as this sounds, Captain, I'd rather remain ignorant of those feelings. I want to be satisfied with what I have here.

Fields.MenuText: But you want to publish your work, don't you? You need to leave the ship for that.
Would you truly be happy?
If that's really what you need, then...

Fields.DialogueText: Not necessarily, Captain. The publishers I've spoken to have been willing to overlook my ... limitations. It's thoughtful of them, but I still wish...
Yes, yes I would, Captain. For the sake of my sanity and my crew's, I would.
It is, Captain. Thank you for being so understanding. You're the sweetest person I have ever met.
If only I was actually human...
Then we would never have met.
Perhaps. Do you believe in soulmates, Captain?
You flatter me, Ark. ... Ugh, there's the siren. Here they come!
@BATTLE
Why do you ask?
What I am trying to say is... perhaps we would have met, regardless of our circumstances.
So the Morganas decided to pursue us, eh? Try and stop the HMS Ark Royal...
@BATTLE
Why doesn't the janitor clean up messes anymore? I'll get the mop mysel-- Ark!? What is the meaning of this?
Hello, Captain! I have decided to renovate the janitor's quarters temporarily as I practice folding this paper crane. Please, have a seat and take a scone with some butter.
Uh, thank you. Wait, does the janitor know about this?
Of course! Do you think I would barge in here and renovate his living area without permission?
Honestly, I never know what to expect from you.
That's more than fair, Captain. Anyway, I confided in the janitor. He has been more than willing to let me borrow his quarters while I do my project.
You still haven't told me what this project is.
I thought it was plum obvious, Captain. But I'll keep it a secret for now.

Fields.MenuText: I might have an inkling. But perhaps I should keep my own secrets.
You're going to make a paper crane army.
You're throwing the janitor a surprise birthday party?

Fields.DialogueText: ...I doubt you actually know.
...Perhaps.
I would, but his birthday was yesterday. I made him a nice trifle, and he seemed to enjoy it.
How's the progress on the crane, anyway?
...I have folded one corner of the paper to the opposite side.
Ark, there's too much sugar in this cake.
Really? I doubled the recipe. Sugar makes cake lighter and airier. Should I whisk it more?
That's a fine idea... if you want the cake to taste of air.
Ark, there you are. I've been looking--
Sorry, Captain. I am a bit busy. These cakes are taller than Buckingham Palace!
I'd say they're taller than the Eiffel Tower!
There's never enough time for me to do what I want. And the oven won't stop just because there's Morganas in firing range. Do you want burnt cake?
Hm. I want to argue, but... even though we need your attention,  if you can't bake, you'll go mad. And that's no trifling matter.
I am not sure if that was a compliment or not. But I'm delighted to hear you understand me.

Fields.MenuText: Why wouldn't I understand?
It is a compliment!
Delighted?

Fields.DialogueText: I should not have doubted you, Captain. Apologies.
Hm. An odd compliment, but a sweet one, that is.
You thought that was a pun? I treacle with surprises, Captain.
Now– Bloody hell! That HURT. Maybe I shouldn't have gotten distracted...
Oh my, Ark Royal!
Oh, dear...
Surprised to hear our sweet Ark curse?
@BATTLE
You wound me, Captain. But not as badly as these Morganas!
*BOOM*
Men, to your stations! We got--
Ugh... too full... can't move...
Why are you lying around? Get up! Morganas incoming, and fast!
But...
I know you're recovering from our feast, but we do have pressing matters to attend to. Please do your best and man the stations.
Yes, Lady!
Wait, what was that about a "feast"?
Ah, I forgot to mention. After me and the chef finished testing my thousand recipes, we had too many leftovers to eat ourselves. We decided to give it to the rest of the crew.
Ark, you can't give them all of that! Fighting men can't live on cakes and pies.
Would you not be bored of the same food over and over?

Fields.MenuText: No, I'm not that fussy.
Hm, I might. I haven't really thought about it.
If it can fit in my mouth, I eat it.

Fields.DialogueText: The rest of the crew cannot live on beans forever, Captain. They need some new stimulation to their diets, albeit it can be unhealthy once in awhile, but that is what it means to be human.
Exactly. Giving them these sweets will not break them, but only encourage them.
... Interestingly put, Captain.
I'll let them off since you were responsible for this, but only if you give me a slice of one of your cherry cakes.
Ah, if only if the Morganas allowed that request.
@BATTLE
Ah, the winds feel so good... fffttt... aaah... I could have sworn I added more sugar to this tea.
Aaaaah!
Hm...what should I pair with this tea... maybe a biscuit? No, we have run out. Ahaha! I shall make a batch later and give the leftovers to the janitor!
We can't shake them! They're closing in!
Ah, but I do wish this tea was a bit hotter...
Ark, what in Heaven's name–
Shh, do you hear that?
That's the Morganas' guns. What else could it be!?
No... the malicious waves are playing tricks on your ears.
Wait, are you serious?
Do you actually hear or see any Morganas?
N-n-no...
It's situations like this that make me believe sirens are real.
I'm quite sure they are not real, Ark.
Hm. Then why do some men want to listen to beautiful women sing in dark spaces and sometimes pleasure them?

Fields.MenuText: Wait, how do you know what that means?
... How do you know about these things?
Uh...

Fields.DialogueText: The janitor told me about it when he let me borrow his room.
I'm not clueless, Captain.
I have a feeling the answer may not be fit for mixed company, Captain.
Morganas might use the illusion of a siren song to attack their victims and hide behind the shadows... Like they have now.
Blast. Everyone, on deck!
Ah, but my tea...
@BATTLE
Ah-ha! Do not slice your way through our defenses, Morganas! Rather... bounce off them.
@BATTLE
Has anyone seen Ark? I'll open every door on this ship if I have t- Oh!
Heh. Your surprise every time you enter here never bores me, Captain. Today we have the cherry cake you wanted to try, sir. Please enjoy yourself-- Ah! Not near the recipe stack. There we are...
So you finally mastered the paper crane, I see? They look kind of cute.
Are they now? Cute or not, their purpose in life is far beyond what any of them can comprehend.
What do you mean?
I am going to fold all of my recipes, all one thousand of them, into paper cranes, Captain.
What?! You're going to let all your hard work go to waste?
On the contrary, Captain. You see, I gave up on the idea of publishing simply because we lacked the resources.
But... If I can show the world these recipes without publishing, my dream would then be complete.
The Japanese crewman told me that whoever folds a thousand paper cranes will have their wish come true. It may be a long shot, but I have to try, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: But what are you going to do with these "recipe cranes"?
How are you going to give these recipes to others?
Don't overdo it. You shouldn't hurt your hands.

Fields.DialogueText: Why, give them to others, of course.
You shall see, Captain. It will be a sight to behold.
Captain, I am not a child. ... But your concern is heartwarming.
Anyway, I have a lot of work to do. Some privacy would be appreciated, Captain.
Yes, of course, Ark.
I do wish she'd stop ignoring me...
... You know, I really shouldn't be surprised. Every time I come here, I'll leave without cleaning supplies and with unnecessary food in my stomach.
Aw, no surprised face this time? You cannot bore me like that, Captain. Today's menu is muffins, with a hint of jam in the middle.
I'll confess that's not a surprise anymore, either. But it would be a surprise if my Captain were to eat one...
Thanks, Ark. ... Wow, you're sitting on a mountain of cranes!
Oh, am I? I have not noticed. Any time I enter my little "crane sanctuary", hours pass by, and before I know it, I've finished hundreds!
It's impressive. Albeit a little claustrophobic...
Because of numerous harmless paper cranes, Captain?

Fields.MenuText: No. I'm scared because there's a ghost living in this closet.
Harmless? You called them an army. Are you sure they won't give us a paper cut?
Are you making fun of me, Ark?

Fields.DialogueText: Your sarcasm has been acknowledged, Captain.
Hehe! You are adorable sometimes, Captain.
Maybe. Maybe I'm implying something else.
I'm not sure I understand that remark, but I better get going now.
Can you close the door on your way out?
You have legs, don't you?
I do, and they're covered in paper cranes.
Fine... but I'm not sure how you will get out.
British ingenuity, Captain.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
How dare you ruin the most classic game of all time, Morganas?! Have you no honor?!
@BATTLE
Knight from B8 to... C6. The game has begun... Englishman versus Lady. Our friendship could be on the line.
I don't think you need to be that dramatic.
I have to, Captain! I must make him my friend, whatever the cost. Even if it means... pun-ishing him.
You would dare?
Oh, I would, Captain...

Fields.MenuText: You are playing a dangerous game here, Ark...
What if that ruins your friendship?
He will never be able to live it down...

Fields.DialogueText: The most dangerous game is the most exciting.
I imagine the fans would love him even more if they catch wind of his... fantastic charms.
I think he will be fine. If worst comes to worst, I will defend his honour like any true Lady would!
Now... when will I hear from him again...
Ah, you're going to make me jealous...
Ark! We have Morganas coming straight for the ship! Prepare for impact!
...So this is how it ends, huh, Captain?
Ark... if there is anything you need to say, now is the time.
There is one thing I never got to, Captain. And... it is about my puns.
Huh?
Lady, it was an honor to serve you! Farewell!
What? Pilot! Get back here! He's trying to get up in the air!... Someone stop him!
Leonard!? Leonard, what are you--!? Aaaah! Take cover, men!...
Leonard... he intercepted that shot with his own plane...

Fields.MenuText: He served you well, Ark. Never forget that.
Leonard...
Ark... come here...

Fields.DialogueText: I will never, Captain... as long as I live. These Morganas will perish by my own guns!
That foolish man... Risking everything... we cannot let his death go to waste. To me, men!
Captain... I... cannot... not now.  Leonard is dead. We cannot let him die in vain.
@BATTLE
Everything is on fire!
Hm... the waves are loud today... But the balance on this railing is not bad at all! Captain, you should give it a shot.
Uh, I'll pass.
We're near the bow of the ship. I can't just stand on the railing and drink tea as naturally as you do.
Really? You have no idea what you are missing here, Captain.
It is not that difficult to master standing on the railing.
See my right foot? It is not completely parallel to my left and the heel is faced in the direction of the ship's floor. Thus, I am always level and secure if something does go amiss.

Fields.MenuText: I keep forgetting how peculiar you are.
Can't you just manifest away if you fall?
What tea are you drinking today?

Fields.DialogueText: Heh, and I keep forgetting I'm a lucky Belle. I have a captain that allows me to be peculiar.
Hm, but then there would be no excitement.
Ceylon, Captain. I have not tried this tea before... It's not quite to my taste.
Perhaps I should have brewed the tea just a little longer. It is rather weak. Ah... a breeze...
Hm... does feel nice, doesn't it.
Heh, just listen... you'll hear the crashing of the waves and Morganas... Morganas?
Did you say that on purpose?
@BATTLE
No, but it's the truth. Sound the alarm!
Hey Ark, I-- Whaa!... Help!...
Ah, Captain, you let the cranes loose! Please step back and push any cranes back in the room. Hah... thank you.
How are you even sitting in there? That room's stuffed with cranes!
Oh that is simple, I will demonstrate. Oof!...
Ark?... Ark!...

Fields.MenuText: Ark, speak up!
... Please tell me this is a joke.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, no, she's in real danger! Hang on, Ark!
Really, Captain, why would I joke about being suffocated by a bunch of cranes!?
You were really stuck deep in there.
Heh... It's fine. I only have a hundred to go!
Are you really sure you want to go through with this? Remind me, what will you do with them, exactly?
At port, they will be unleashed.
Hm, make sure to notify me before you do. I want to see all your hard work come to life.
Captain...
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Chess! Do you understand it, Morganas?
@BATTLE
Hm, hm... Check, Englishman!...
Hm? Did you win your correspondence chess match?
Very close, Captain! I have him cornered here. D3 Knight. This knight will secure victory for our friendship... no, all of England!
A bit of an exaggeration, don't you think?
His king has not moved a space. And there is no one nearby to stop me from taking him!
Wait... are you sure?
Positive, Captain!

Fields.MenuText: Can I give you some pointers while I'm here?
That seems a bit too easy. Do you think he's trying to trap you?
I believe in you, Ark. Knock him out!

Fields.DialogueText: Not necessary, Captain. As you may see, this is a done game in the next turn.
Hardly, Captain. This Englishman thinks he can master the business world, but the world of chess... oh, no, no!
I will, Captain!
Tea... tea... where are you? I usually hide it behind this crate, but it is not there. What? Is there someone here? No one comes back here but– Harry?
Harry, what are you doing out here?
Lady... I can't... The voices...
What can't you do, Harry? You're scaring me! What voices?!
... I'm sorry, I'm weak. The voices are right... Goodbye, Lady.
Harry, don't go too far out over the rail– No!... Harry!...
Ark, what happened?! Why are you screaming?
Harry... He... jumped...
Wait... what?...
He thought he was weak and he... Uwah... I could not save him, sir... I am... so sorry, Captain...
This is not your fault, Ark. If we'd known, we would have done everything in our power to prevent him from jumping. You know that...

Fields.MenuText: Talk to me, Ark.
Say something...
Ark, you did everything you could.

Fields.DialogueText: ... I'm sorry...
I need to be alone, Captain...
You keep saying that, but doesn't change the fact he's dead! And why?!
Ark, please wait!...
Ark, please wait!...
Ark, please wait!...
Ark! We've got visual contact with the enemy! Meet me on the bridge if you're not there already!
@BATTLE
Sailor... what is the matter?
First Leonard... now Harry... how many more of my friends will I lose?...
I... I am weak, sailor. But... I am the spirit of this ship... if I am weak, then so are we all. I must show the others to keep pushing against all adversary, even if everything is crumbling.
My hands are shaking, sailor. If I could have saved them, I would have. But I could not predict Leonard's or Harry's actions. I am not God, but... one of you all.
Gary, what's wrong?
My friend's death... I can't... keep going like this knowing they're both gone... Knowing this war is hopeless against the Morganas.
What's the use of living? Does anyone know?

Fields.MenuText: No one knows, Gary.
Stay calm, Gary. Everyone is doing their damnedest to stay alive. They'll help you, if you let them.
You know in your heart. Have you already forgot Leonard and Harry?

Fields.DialogueText: He is correct, Gary.
Would they have wanted you to die too? You're their mate. They would have saved you no matter what the cost.
... Thank you, Captain. Thank you, Lady. I am sorry to make such a fuss.
No apologies needed for any of us. We're here for each other, all right?
Yes, Captain.
If you ever need me, please call upon me and I will be at your side. No matter what.
Thank... thank you... so much Lady... I'm crying again, but they're... tears of joy...
Mine too... Captain?
A-ah... I'm not crying...
There's life outside this hell. We have to believe that if we're to go on.
Why didn't you save them, Lady? Why?!... Answer me!
*ALARM*
... They can't even give us one good moment, can they?
@BATTLE
See this crane, Morganas? The hopes of all humankind are held within these pages!
Recipes bring hope?
Many humans love baking, do you not?
@BATTLE
Come to think of it, Ark, are you sure that crane making is Japanese and not of English origin?
Captain, that's ridiculous.
Well, back when you made a bunch of puns, you only used dessert names originating from England, and not any other part of the world.
Now, you seem to be readily adopting another culture. Why the change of heart?
We will never progress if we stay within the confines of our own prison, right?
Didn't you also say it was necessary to be confined? You said you'd go mad if you knew freedom.
Hm... I did. But after I started folding cranes, playing chess with the Englishman, and having you by my side every day... the world seems a little less bleak.
I feel I can take on new challenges without being frightened, Captain. I know that I want to live... and I know why.

Fields.MenuText: I'll support you every step of the- wait, I'm on that list?
That is great to hear, Ark!
There is nothing we can't accomplish together!

Fields.DialogueText: Yes. Do not look embarrassed, Captain. You've helped me more times than can be counted, and for that... For everything... Thank you.
Indeed it is. So continue to be at my side, Captain. Never leave me...
... That calls for a cheese pun, Captain.
*ALARM*
Hm... Captain, I have a favor to ask. Please come to the janitor's room as soon as possible.
Will do. If Morganas ever give us peace...
@BATTLE
Ah, thank you for coming back here... especially since you had such a bad experience with this place.
Don't remind me. Anyway, why did you bring me down here now?
Here... It is my last recipe... a recipe for the perfect cup of Ceylon tea.
I thought you didn't like Ceylon tea. Why did you include this in your recipes?
...To remember everyone. You, Harry, Leonard, and Gary... The Ceylon tea has a special meaning to me. Peculiar, but warm... Like my crew.
That's very thoughtful...
That is why you get the honour of folding the final crane in the collection, Captain.
Me? I'm not sure I'll do a good job, Ark...
Do your best, Captain. I will love it, deformed or not.
I know you meant well, but that sounded insulting!

Fields.MenuText: So I fold the paper to the opposite side here... like this?
So I pull this side of the paper up?
Squash this corner for the head...

Fields.DialogueText: Ah... It seems a bit deformed, Captain... But I'll gladly accept it... Thank you so much, sir!
You tore off his tail, Captain! The poor little one is now dismembered... Oh well, he's beautiful all the same.
No! That portion is for his body!
Sorry, Ark, I failed...
No, it is all right. I will gladly accept this crane from you, Captain. It has your warmth radiating from it.
Ark...
Anyway, we're closing in on port. I have to make some preparations now. See you later!
Ark? What's wrong?
Checkmated.
Wait, you won? Congrats!
No, Captain. I lost, outright. I did not anticipate his bishop would annihilate my king, who was out in the open. I feel... foolish.
You're not foolish, Ark. Your goal of this all was to be his friend, remember?
Hm... that is true. I wonder if it worked. Ah... I remember the last part of the message, but I'm not sure if it is relevant.
Oh? What is it?
The pie cries.
... Captain, I just realized... do you know what this means?

Fields.MenuText: That you have a new best friend?
The man who'd make a pun would pick a pocket.
Was that even a pun?

Fields.DialogueText: Yes! I am so elated that I might bake the whole crew a new cake recipe!
Captain! Be kind! He is trying and that is what matters!
I consider it to be one, Captain.
I have a friend... A friend that makes bad puns... I have done it, Captain!
I'm so happy for you, Ark! Do I hear wedding bells?
Don't be absurd! There's only one person I'd wish to marry, and -- well--
@BATTLE
You'll have to tell me about them - after we beat these Morganas!
The waves are never as threatening as people think they are. Like gentle roaring giants. Only this time... I get to appreciate it with someone. Right, Captain?
Just... just... please catch me if I fall...
Focus on your tea, sir! The fear naturally subsides after awhile. Ow! You're gripping me too hard, Captain!
Ah... sorry. Is that better?
Yes, thank you... Focus on the waves, and on the blissful nature of the tea before you. Small ripples appear on the surface, but that does not bother you because-- Captain!
AAAAH!... Ow... Dratted tea cup... Help!...
Captain, I got you! Hang on to my shoulders! Phew... Are you all right, sir?
Barely... Thanks, Ark...
What's wrong?
I endangered you because I was selfish and wanted to share my joy with you... instead... I... I am so sorry...

Fields.MenuText: I'm alive, aren't I?
It's fine, Ark. I got to live a little more than I have before. Thanks for sharing that moment with me.
This is unlike you to apologize. Where is your stiff upper lip, Ark?

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, you are, Captain...
... You are most welcome, Captain... Thank you for holding on to me.
... Heh. You are correct, Captain. When you care about someone so much...
Good. And as long as I'm alive, we can deal with these Morganas... Together, right?
Always, Captain!
@BATTLE
You cannot delay the inevitable, Morganas! I have an event to attend!
@BATTLE
So... you sure you want to do this? We're at port and there's hundreds of people. No one will blame you if you want to go–
Captain... I have thought about keeping the cranes a million times. No matter what, I want this world to see this... and remember that... I was alive...
... Heh. Thank you, Ark...
Anyway, are you ready for the surprise?

Fields.MenuText: I'm ready, Ark!
What are you going to do?
...Are you positive?

Fields.DialogueText: All right! Here goes...
You will see, Captain...
Captain, please! I've made up my mind!
Wait for the east wind... now! Hah!... Look at them fly, Captain!
The cranes... are floating over the town and the port!
Yes... this way, someone out there will see my recipes. They will know I lived...
Heh, I am thankful I remembered to put my name on each page...
You did that before you knew you wanted to turn them all into cranes?
Yes... At first, I was going to put them in bottles and set them out to sea, but... Where would I get that many bottles in the first place?
Yeah, I'd imagine that'd be a– ow. Huh? A crane came back to us.
Huh? Please unfold it, Captain!
...The Ceylon tea recipe.
... Heh, thank you for having me, Captain.
That we were alive. That you had me, and that I had you.
Your recipe. Well, I never...
Well... You came back to me, Ark.
You said you believed in soulmates, didn't you? Two people who would meet, no matter what the circumstances?
Mmhm. Two people who'd... always come back to each other. No matter what.
Hm... It's been a while since I released the cranes... I wonder--
Ark!... Ark!... Look!...
Huh? Captain! You are out of breath! Pace yourself... what happened?
I have a message for you from the port. It's - it's amazing news!
What is it?
A chef found your crumpet recipe crane, and he made it at his restaurant.
They are naming it "The Ark Royal"... and that's not all! Next year, he will feature the recipe in a cookbook that will credit you!

Fields.MenuText: ...Are those good tears?
That's good news, right?
Ark? Come here. I'll hold you...

Fields.DialogueText: ... Mm... I think so, Captain.  Thank you...
Wonderful news, Captain. I've never been this happy before. Thank you... for everything.
Captain... Uwaa... Thank you... I'm so grateful to have you as my captain...
Heh, there, there... You found your dream. Your life's had a purpose already! We'll see what else the world has to offer us, all right?
Yes, Captain! Heh... but first, we'll see to these Morganas.
@BATTLE
Captain? Are you busy?
Ah, Ark! No, come in. What can I do for you?
Um... I am not good with words, so... I'll do this instead.
Huh? Why are you closing the door? Whoa!
After everything you have done for me... I have to repay my captain somehow. Will you allow me to? I... love you too much not to...
... I won't say no, Ark. Please.
Thank you, Captain...

Fields.MenuText: Uh, what exactly are you going to do?
Ark?...
What will you do to me?

Fields.DialogueText: You will see. Close your eyes.
Close your eyes, Captain.
Close your eyes first, Captain...
All right... Huh?
Open them again.
Wait... what is all of this?
A basket full of jam tarts! I remember how I teased you too much before about not getting any. So that is my way of repaying you!... Captain?...
Ah... It's... it's nothing. Thank you, Ark, really. You're the greatest.
Heh, and Morganas ruin the mood...
After you... my Lady.
Are you disappointed? Did you have something else in mind, Captain?
Maybe. But I guess that will have to wait.
